Chinese activist who fled house arrest heads to US

A blind Chinese activist whose escape from a rural village set off a diplomatic tussle between Beijing and Washington is now heading to the US. (AP, 10:09 a.m.)

DiMasi diagnosed with rare cancer

Former House Speaker Salvatore F. DiMasi, in prison for corruption, was diagnosed with cancer in his tongue and lymph nodes, his family confirmed Friday. (Boston Globe)

Sox' bad start makes tickets hard to sell

In the wake of the Red Sox collapse last fall and their last-place standing this spring, season ticket holders' seats are selling for less than face value, if at all. (Globe)

Boston branch of NAACP opening
a new office in Roxbury

Established 101 years ago, the Boston affiliate is the oldest chartered branch of the NAACP and will unveil its new office inside the Mall of Roxbury today. (Globe, 9 a.m.)

Momenta leads Globe 100
